performer: Plastics and the Threat to Our Waterways and Oceans
description: Moderated by Elissa Yoder Mann of Sierra Club Ohio. Panelists are Kylienne Shaul of The OSU School of Environment & Natural Resources on Plastics in the Oceans; Chad Stephens of Sierra Club Ohio on Plastics, Pipelines, & the Appalachian Fracking Hub and Elissa on Plastic Bag Legislation in Ohio.

“Black Lotus Sanctuary” centers around a collective.  Black Lotus Sanctuary is holding SPACE for people to feel free and safe in their movement, expression,  thoughts & conversation ushering in transformation as one define’s it for themself!

performer: Elissa Yoder Mann, Conservation Manager for Sierra Club Ohio
description: To explore, enjoy, & protect the wild places of the earth; To practice & promote the responsible use of the earth's ecosystems & resources; To educate & enlist humanity to protect and restore the quality of the natural & human environment; and to use all lawful means to carry out these objectives.
Current Portage County Commissioner. Former State Representative (D-Kent). 2018 Democratic Candidate for Ohio Secretary of State.
Johnny is a well known & trusted cannabis entrepreneur in Ohio.  He has made it his duty to bring the highest quality information & design when it comes to cannabis culture in Ohio!
I will be available to answer questions regarding Ohio's medical marijuana program and to discuss how marijuana can be helpful in dozens of conditions.
In our current political atmosphere much is at risk. This is not the time to be discouraged or to give up the ongoing work of pushing for justice. If we are silent or still, we lose.
A community panel of professionals and individual activists who have lost someone to suicide and the opioid crisis. The process of grief, supporting each other and community resources distributed.

Seasoned and knowledgeable ORG Ambassadors will facilitate discussion about cannabis from a variety of perspectives: status of Ohio’s medical marijuana program, updates on Ohio’s bills to permit growing industrial hemp under the 2018 Farm Bill and the possibility of adult use legalization in 2020.

performer: Media literacy in the post-fact era
description: A panel of media professionals who will discuss media literacy in the modern era. The panel will cover issues such as managing social media commentary/input, reporting on semi-truths and lies when they come from the mouths of political figures, both sideism, and media framing.

Because of the Administration's harmful policies toward refugees families continue to face prolonged separation from each other, missing important milestones in each others lives.  Here their stories and what you can do to advocate for change.

performer: Cannabis, Sad State of the State of Ohio
description: The Cannabis Museum collects of the historical use of cannabis food, fuel, fiber and medicine. Ohio is moving forward providing access to cannabis medicines for specific conditions and adopting regulations for industrial hemp. A look at this history gives lessons on where this progress can take us.

The Future of Music
Bruce Garfield  Executive Director Columbus Music Commission, Marcy Mays, Ace of Cups and of  Scrawl.
Moderator:  
Gabor Klein, Artist Manager 

A panel discussion about the state of the music industry in Columbus and what we can do to increase awareness on the national scene.

Yoga-Well-Being is to still the mind by moving the breath through the body. We strive to promote a holistic lifestyle through regular practice. Reduce tension, develop flexibility, strength and learn new breathing techniques.

Sharing and exploring Yoga from a playful approach. Offering modifications and demonstration of proper alignment.  Mindfulness focusing on intentional breathing, to help all build a strong, grounded and personal practice foundation.

performer: Easy To Learn Chi Kung (Qigong) w/ Darryl & Ro-z Mendelson
description: Energize Your Body, Relax & Calm Your Mind and Raise Your Spirit. Some examples of different kinds of Chi Kung (Qigong) that are easy to learn that work in different ways to make you healthier and happier.
Taijiquan, Silk Reeling & Qigong Class (our normal class brought to Comfest) - this will be held west of the pond

Rise Mental Fitness Studio provides its members opportunities to proactively work on mental health and fitness through online activities and programs. Join us for an empowering conversation where we will share our mental health journeys and mental fitness goals.

Proposed Performance: Rethink, reduce, reuse, recycle – thinking outside the box generates a participatory, interactive session highlighting simple tools and processes to increase garden produce and reduce garden toil.
A mini-workshop that integrates yoga, meditation, and writing exercises to break through blocks and unleash creative energy.

performer: Bill Pickard, Curator of Archaeology, Ohio History Connection
description:
Flint Ridge Flint: Ohio’s Rock of Ages
Flint Ridge Flint is famous for its high quality and amazing colors. For millennia it was used by American Indians to make the tools and weapons  now commonly found on archaeology sites throughout Ohio,  Flint Ridge is truly the “ Great Indian Quarry of Ohio".

MC Natrix, is a Colombian peace activist/songwriter/singer and dancer. As teenage she devoted to the teaching of dance to teens, worked in the creation of conscious rap and the organization of events as a way of resistance to the violence in her country. Now she is releasing the EP  "Awareness".

performer: Tish O'Dell and the Ohio Community Rights Network (OHCRN)
description: The OHCRN performs “The Wise Guys for Profit City,” a short spoof on the  Wizard of Oz, in which Dorothy tries to find her way back to democracy; followed by Tish O’Dell speaking about the Rights of Nature and the Lake Erie Bill of Rights with Q&A afterward.

Can a Green New Deal match the scale of the Climate Crisis? Learn how a new approach to economic and fiscal policies can fund a transition to renewable energy, create a Job Guarantee program, and provide Medicare for All. Dr. Fadhel Kaboub, Denison Univ, Pres Global Inst for Sustainable Prosperity.

Together with our partners, we're working to protect access to affordable, safe, and legal abortion in Ohio. Join us to learn about threats to your reproductive freedom and how you can join the fight to defend it.

Ready for 100 is a campaign of the Sierra Club working to fight climate change by encouraging cities to commit to shifting 100% of their energy generation to renewables by 2050. Come hear about the campaign, our progress thus far, and what you can do to help!
Join us for our annual awards show when we present this year's grant recipients, honored volunteers, honored activist, honored artist, and honored community organization!
We can't do this without you and we are in desperate need ov volunteers. Please sign up today by going to www.comfest.com/volunteer.

performer: Airing Out the "Dirty" Laundry (Andrea Downs and You)
description: Airing Out the “Dirty” Laundry is an ongoing, participatory art project. It is a collection of women’s stories about strength, unity, and resistance of oppression, injustice, and exclusion. When we reveal our stories, we create the possibility of shifting the narrative.

Dr. Peter Howison is a medical doctor who prescribes Cannabis to patients. Joe Brennan is owner of Botanical Depot and an expert on CBD. Along with Johnny Cannabis of OhioCannabis.com, they will present a workshop about Cannabis Medicine in Ohio.

Sabrina Ali Jamal-Eddine is an Arab-American Spoken Word Poet, Activist, and Feminist Scholar from Ohio State. Sabrina has founded a hiphop literacy and spoken word poetry program for incarcerated male youth as well as a music program at an affirmative action preschool in the Columbus community.

Come one come all to this beginner/intermediate yoga class in the park! All are welcome and the class will be free! Please join me in kicking off the last day of ComFest weekend with a meditation followed by a vinyasa flow. I look forward to seeing your smiling faces there :)

Fit Yoga is a vinyasa practice for beginners and beyond. It is designed to energize the body while decreasing stress. It is a practice of synchronizing mindful movement with the breath, descending into a slow flow and coming to a pause to honor stillness.
Taijiquan, Silk Reeling & Qigong Class (our normal class brought to Comfest) - this will be held west of the pond

Discover The Simplest and Most Powerful NATURAL lifestyle secret that has improved numerous lives for over 110 years. Prof. Spira, PhD will discuss why "Mucus-free" is the original "Plant-Based" dietary system, and how it has helped thousands to heal naturally.

A profound and inspiring way to start your ComFest Sunday.  Experience the Oneness of All through the vibrational waves of crystal bowls, metal sing bowls,   bells and tingshaws along with a gong meditation. Ben and Jo Nagel have been sharing their sound healing for over 20 years.

performer: You Inc. LIVE! with Ria Greiff and Guests
description: Each week, Ria Greiff, Producer and Host of NPR member station, WCBE's two weekly shows about elevating your emotional intelligence, You Inc. and YouTune, sits down with a special guest. There will be a LIVE! recording of the show with a very special Comfest guest and you too can be on the air!

Dynamic speakers Joy Lawrence of Pure Joy Massage and Yoga, Clayton Freeman of Can't Believe It's Vegan and Noelle Bartholdi of Dragonfly Consulting and Wellness discuss how their vegan services can empower your vegan shift

Franks work in Guided Meditation has yielded three new truths! The first is: Excitement is Love Amplified! The very elusive Love vibration is infinitely more experienceable when we become excited. The second is: Your Mind and Spiritual Mind are fully blended. And third: Focus expands everything!

performer: Jeff Radcliff (of Chen Taiji of Ohio)
description: Basics of Uniting the Mind/Body Earth Connection thru Qigong to heal yourself

We will have several folks who are integral parts of the urban gardening movement in Columbus to discuss how to start a community garden, how to sustain it, get volunteers, soil amendments, plant pathology and how to organize your efforts.

The ETSS Family Care Department will host a presentation on Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention. The goal will be for participants to learn to identify different forms of trafficking, recognize red flags, and understand local and national efforts to combat trafficking.
Poetry Performance
From money laundering to tearing families apart, this discussion will outline reasons why we need to stop Trump.

performer: Byrd Polar and Climate Research Center
description: Learn about climate changes that Columbus has already experienced, impacts that we are likely to face in the future, and actions that individuals and groups can take to make our community more climate resilient. The Columbus Climate Adaptation Plan will be shared.

Courtyard Estates is one of the last holdouts of affordable housing for seniors in Columbus. But luxury apartment developer Preferred Living wants to displace the residents and gentrify the neighborhood. Our DSA chapter is taking steps to stop them. Come hear about our efforts and what you can do.

The Transition Movement invites us to re-imagine community. Find out about  local initiatives: Food, Energy, Politics, Media, Transit, Politics, Co-Housing, Health Care.  Small groups explore how to become change agents in the Transition Movement and then share insights with the whole group.

Staley Munroe is the Creative Director of Prizm Magazine. A Columbus native, Staley's career spans from NY to LA, working as a photographer and art director within creative industries. A resilient transgender woman, she fights for equality raising awareness and understanding of Trans life.

We're Ohio’s statewide abortion fund. Founded in 1992, we're dedicated to helping Ohioans afford their reproductive choices by connecting those needing abortion to financial and practical support so they can access the abortion care they need.

performer: Help us clear out the park Monday at 11:00 AM
description: We need to load all this stuff on some truck. Have some time to help? Come on Down to the Park and help us. Meet at the Shelterhouse. Trust me you will find us.
